Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SuperSalvador
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights through expedia.com looking for a place to just dissapear from our rutine, Palmas de Lucia worked perfectly. We didnt use the pool or the restaurant since we wanted to visit touristic places like El Yunque, Maunabo and Fajardo's lighthouses. The hotel front desk employees were very helpful as we arrived at the property. The room was quite spacious with a nice king size bed and a big bathroom. We noticed that the bed sheets and decorations were a bit outdated. Overall Palmas de Lucia provided good acommodations and we believe it has potential for better updates in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ok...”
Reviews.Author: Simara
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good: Very nice and peaceful place. The staff is friendly and all the areas are clean. This inn is very Eco friendly which is a big plus. It has a very nice park but only for toddlers. It has several hammocks, half a basketball court and a volleyball area. They also provide free and excellent coffee in the mornings and also a snack at 3:00pm that includes cookies, crackers, soda and coffee (NICE). The bad: They do not provide towels for the pool. The beach in front of the inn is dirty, very dirty (the beach is public so the municipal government is the one that needs to clean the beach but they don't). The bathrooms are tiny and it takes a while for the water to get hot. The ok: Our rate which is a good rate included breakfast and dinners with tips included. Not a great variety of dishes and the portions are average but very good flavor. It's worth it to get the all inclusive rate but do not expect an amazing culinary experience. The kids play area needs things for kids 3-12. The pool is a good size and it was always clean. This inn is nice but you get what you pay for. Yabucoa is a town where you can relax and read a good book by the pool or beach. I did not see one pub, bar or nice restaurant in the whole town so if you want an active night life this is not the place to go. I do recommend it for families with small children, couples and elderly people.

Reviews.Title: “Little treasure in Puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: danette55
Reviews.Content: After deciding to take an last minute drive on the eastern coast of Puerto Rico and having no reservations, we continued on the beautiful Panoramic Road. I called and was guided to this delightful little inn! Rooms were clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. The restaurant had great Puerto Rican food and even though we arrived a bit late in the night, we were welcomed and quickly settled.

Reviews.Title: “Stingy...”
Reviews.Author: Ginavals
Reviews.Content: Okay folks... Everything is done halfway here. The beach looks good from afar but its really dirty once u look at it closely, mostly everything in the room is stingy, stingy, stingy. It begs to be upgraded but the owners are sadly just as stingy, AC without a thermostat and activated by the room key (btw you only get one), a mini fridge and microwave on the floor and one on top of the other... Tsk tsk tsk they just coulda done better. The front desk wasnt bad... Just a tad cold with its personnel. The BEST thing about it is the food which tastes great for the most part but its portions are, you guessed it, on the stingy side too. Bottom line, everything could be better. And it just isnt. OH I ALMOST FORGOT! The TV has only 11 channels, mostly local and its satellite dish loses signal constantly due to the wind (one of the few good things as well) but u can barely watch TV. "How stingy", right? Thats what I thought too.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this.”
Reviews.Author: jwmci
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get off the beaten path and had heard good things about the Paradors, so we tried this one. It appears to be primarily for island families. There were a lot of young people with their kids. Since the pool is in the middle of the rooms, the pool noise dominates the hotel. The furnishings are a little dated. The area around the hotel is definitely rundown. The beach has no facilities, such as chairs or even a flat place to put a towel. There is a public park next door which gets a lot of use. The service varied dramatically, based on who was working the desk. The restaurant was marginal, both in appearance and food. The highlight was the lobby parrot.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to relax with the family”
Reviews.Author: marivaz
Reviews.Content: I when for my bday a gift from my husband we dint take the kids for use to have a good time...we enjoy it even thou we miss our kids this place is perfect for a family relax vacation it has a nice pool of 2 to 4 feet the place is always clean....everything was nice but for one thing noi music they should have a radio around the pool it dosent have to be loud but for everyone could hear it and enjoy it since it was tooooo quite but beside that I lkuv it and would book me another trip there but this time with my lovin one my kids food was great but don't have a lot to choose from we had to go to another rest to eat some mofongo con relleno de camarones cuz they don't have that I recommend it to spend with the family not to go alone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent second time, and this time with more friends!”
Reviews.Author: RichiePR77
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, it was great! The service is wonderful, from the food to the rooms. The areas always are clean, even the common areas. Food is delicious, even with the all-inclusive offer. One night they offer a special plate and didn't charge extra for it. Rooms are big, bed are super comfortable, and hot water is available, even with solar water heaters (and we went with two partly cloud days). And the personnel is always with a great smile and ready to help. We invited this time a friend with his family (two small children and two ederly ones), and everyone enjoy their stay. Tips: Check for the All-inclusive offer (is the best way), ask at the counter for Wifi password, and... ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at the Palmas de Lucia!”
Reviews.Author: divecozumel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in PR where we used this hotel as a jumping off point to see the south east end of the island. We had a king size, very comfortable bed, with a patio on ground level. The room was spotless, maid service daily, nice sized room and good air conditioning and frig. Yabucoa the town has a nice Ralph's supermarket, and Walgreens for any drinks or snacks you would want. The owners Juan and Maria Lopez are very gracious hosts, the front desk ladies the best, and the bartenders make a mean Pina Colada! The beach just down from the hotel is public and not maintained by the resort, the water was choppy during our stay, so we went about 40 minutes away to Luquillo Beach where the water was calm and the beach maintained. El Yunque is about 45 minutes down the expressway, and the night kayaking in Farjardo is about the same. The internet is password protected, simply call the front desk for the password and no worries. The pool and grounds were beautifully maintained, the work out room now has a new treadmill, only had a chance to use it once but very nice. We only ate at the restaurant once for breakfast and it was good. Loved PR and this hotel, hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful and relaxing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: union90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a break from the day to day stresses and this was perfect. The facilities were excellent, the beach was within walking distance (3 min. walk); the food was excellent and so was the service. The hospitality was excellent as well. The only negative comment I can make is that the wireless internet service was non-existent in my room. In this case that was not really an issue as this ensured that I focus on what I came there for (disconnect from day to day stuff). Overall I would certainly return and also recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommened”
Reviews.Author: traviesa694
Reviews.Content: Location: Nice location, really close to the beach, nice and calm. Reception: Really nice and the girls were very courteous. Restaurant: In the mornings you may find the service a little slow but the food is awesome and the service is great! Pool: The pool is big, it was clean and very nice, the hammocks made it perfect! Recreational areas: They have a basketball court near the pool, my husband and I had a good time playing. They have a volleyball arena court, very nice too. Also they have a mini gym with a Sauna for two. We used the gym but they really need to consider changing the cardio machine for new ones, they are notable deteriorated. We didnâ€™t use it but they have a game room too. Room: The king bed is very comfortable. The room was cozy and clean. The bathroom is big and the closets are spacious. The balcony with view to the pool and the beach is very nice. They had a coffee maker and they supply a coffee bag per day, perfect for coffee lovers like me! They had a small refrigerator perfect for having drinks and snacks for the night. The A/C was working perfectly. Internet access: In the rooms, pool and restaurant. Perfect! We really enjoyed the time in this place, 100% recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lavaun
Reviews.Content: The first day i checked in i eas moved 4 times! first room sliding doors would not lock, second room frig broken, third room sliding doors not locking, forth room phone did not work. met with the owner to discuss this and she claimed i under paid my hotel stay. I stated that was what i was quoted...her responce was her front desk employee was taking the cut in pay for their error....I got no compensation for being moved 3 times and for the phone not working. The owner herself stated she was docking front desk fo the errors of room charge. but owner state she was not losing no money. I was not compensated for my move from room to room and for non functioning phone!!!!! This hotel was a joke even better the GREEDY owner was more of a joke!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best anniversary at the best place!”
Reviews.Author: RichiePR77
Reviews.Content: We came today from a weekend at the Parador Palmas de LucÃ­a. Is the best place for a great vacation. All the excellent attention we got and the service was great. The food was the best. We got the All-inclusive package (which, by the way, recommend it), so we didn't worry about nothing. You go to the restaurant, write down the time you want to eat and what you want, you come at that time and give the room number and 5 minutes later... voila! food is at your table. Quality of food is great. You have a room with a small balcony but with a beautiful view. A/C worked great. We had a small glitch with the hot water, but we didn't understand at first, this is a green hotel. It's a solar heater, and the first day it wasn't so hot... but the next two days, it was solved. The pool, albeit small, is was perfect if you want to relax, even enjoy it with your family, The beach near is beautiful. This is a green hotel, so you will se reciclying and reuse tips all over, but it works. Looking forward to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: LivinginNewYork
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I were born in Puerto Rico but have lived in the New York City metro area most of our lives. We have been drawn to the Island over the years and have stayed mostly with family and on occassion at Resort properties. On our most recent visit to the Island, we decided to see and seek lodging on the southernmost part of the Island.On our first 2 nights we stayed in the beautiful Ponce Hilton and were treated like royalty. But then we left to go to the DUMP known as Palmas de Lucia. The beach is full of garbage, and is not attractive at all. The Inn accomodations, staff and food service are also very subpar. During our first night at Parador de Lucia, we were awaken at midnight by a drunken group of people, 3 men and a women who occupied the adjacent room. I made several phone calls to the front desk but no one answered so I looked up in the phone book the number for the police. I don't know if the police ever showed up but the noice subsided around 3 in the morning. In the morning I found out from the front desk clerk that they lock the entrance doors to the Inn at night and the Police would not be able to enter. Great security, but what if you need outside HELP. I then told the clerk that we were leaving because of concerns for our safety but they insisted on billing me for my 3 night reservation. It seems I made the mistake of initialling their check in sheet notifying me that under no circumstances they would credit me for an early check out, in other words (NO REFUNDS). It is three months later and they are still insisting I pay for 3 nights without regard for the horible time we had our first night there. Fromers gave them a decent recommendation and is the reason we made a reservation in the first place but all is not what it seems online. Be very careful and should you make the mistake of booking a room there remember the Police cannot get in to save you. A very disappointed and disgusted Puerto Rican in New York

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay will be back”
Reviews.Author: jamaicabound3
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law and I recently stayed at Palmas de Lucia. The check in staff was very friendly we had a wait because the people in front of us had not booked and paid online but when I told the front desk staff we needed to rush because we were closing on a house they expedited our check in. The food was great my mother-in-law hates to eat out but she LOVED the food there. She said the red snapper was the best she had ever eaten! I am vegetarian and they had no problems accommodating my diet (the marinara sauce was excellent). Ozmin and Ramon were excellent waiters!!! The rooms were clean a few ants were seen at times but nothing to complain about. All rooms have a TV and a refrigerator. The pool was very clean. Also being in the health profession I found it very impressive the hotel has an AED!! The beach is down the road it has sea grass and not maintained by the hotel. The water was rough while we were there but it was still beautiful to look at. Great place to relax and reflect. The only complaint we had was the bar down the road plays the music REALLY loud on the weekend (it is against the law to play music during the week). (They do make great drinks.) My husband and I just drowned the music out with the TV but my mother-in-law had a rough time with the loud music. Next time we will request rooms down the hall. If you are looking for a "5 star hotel" this hotel is not for you! If you are looking for off the beaten path were you can spend time with native Puerto Ricans, and enjoy the ocean then this is the place for you. It is best to rent a car to travel to the Bacardi tour, to the rainforest and/or any other great spots in PR . Before you go on an excursion stop by the stores along the road by the hotel. They do speak English and carry ice chests, ice, drinks, snacks, etc. The Puerto Rican people at the stores were very welcoming. We chose this hotel because we were in Puerto Rico to purchase a house. We wanted to save money but also wanted to be close to our house ; the Palmas de Lucia was the PERFECT spot. Since the Palmas is close to our new house if our house is not finished when we return to PR we will definitely stay at the Palmas de Lucia if our house is fixed we will definitely be back for meals and to visit the GREAT STAFF.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Parador Experience”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Adventures
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GO HERE. You will be disappointed. I have heard great things about other Paradores, but this one is an exception. They have a nice website on which they advertise their proximity to the beach and "exquisite" restaurant menu, among other things. The public beach next to the property is 100 feet away as advertised, but they left out the fact that is full of garbage and inhabited by stray dogs (one of which I saw lying dead in the surf, and it looked like it had been there a while). I have never been so disgusted by a beach before in my life; not what one looks for on vacation. The restaurant was a similarly terrible experience. The service was slow and confused, and the food was even worse. $15+ USD for reheated steak and frozen vegetables. Enough said. In all fairness the room was clean and comfortable, but considering the other factors, not at all worth what they charge. I would not even recommend visiting this area of the island. All of the beaches seemed to be severely neglected and there is an oil refinery 10 minutes up the highway.

Reviews.Title: “wished I could say the stay was nice”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper1013
Reviews.Content: Well to continue a bad trip after a credit card was lost on vacation my wife and I tried to make the best of a bad situation. So we decided to go to the hotel...... what a mistake we were told to wait for the manager who was eating lunch. so we waited..... and waited....... and waited I wish I could tell you her name but she never came out. ohh it was after 1:30 when we arrived. We explained our situation to the hostess and had our bank on the line in order to authorize the sale and were promptly told no. We both had identification and our passports and were told "We can't tell if it it's really you" yes because Identity thieves carry 3 forms of ID that include their social security cards. All in all after being treated like a criminal you couldn't pay me enough to stay at this hotel or any other under the same management. So they gave us the best anniversary gift they could.... WOW!!! Really you shouldn't have!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprized”
Reviews.Author: travelingalDetroit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Parador Palmas De Lucia, and we were completely satisfied with our stay. Everything â€“ our room, the hallways, and the public areas were immaculately clean. Maid service was daily and efficient. The towels were full size, fluffy and replaced daily. Our room came with a coffee pot, microwave and small fridge. The food was good, and the service in the dining room outstanding. We had a problem with our patio door, and within minutes of reporting it, the owner himself arrived with a screw driver and fixed it. The pool wasnâ€™t huge, but it was more than adequate and like everything else, scrupulously cared for and clean. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and welcoming. While the immediate area doesnâ€™t offer much â€œtouristâ€� stuff, the location is perfect for those who have a car and want to travel the south coast and east coast. The only disappointment was the beach. Itâ€™s public â€“ not owned by the hotel - and is a weekend hang out for local young people who donâ€™t care about the trash they leave. This is not your average tourist hotel â€“ there were days when I am pretty sure that we were the only â€œNorte-Americanoâ€™s" in residence. But if you are seeking a taste of the real Puerto Rico, then I can highly recommend it. We will definitely go back. I have paid a lot more for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “My honest opinion...”
Reviews.Author: pch71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palmas de Lucia on the weekend of Sept 29th-Oct 1st. I have to say that I have mixed feelings about this place. Check in was quick and the lady at the front desk was very nice. Small pool, but my nieces and nephews did not seem to mind, they had a great time at the pool. The area around the pool was nice, but outside the hotel is kind of dirty and the beach is no a good one for swimming. I found a broken beer bottle on the sand. The rooms were ok, nothing fancy, with a little fridge and microwave, and the beds were comfortable. But it was very humid inside the room! The bathroom was another story. Very bad design, and no air vents. Had a hard time to get warm water, it was like extremely cold or extremely hot. After a while trying, we got warm water. The outlet was broken, so I could not plug my hair dryer. Apparently this is an ongoing problem, since another room in our party had the same problem. And the room smelled musty. The room had a balcony looking to the pool. My husband and father in law had breakfast at the restaurant, and they were not happy. They said it was not good at all. We went on sunday to a nearby bakery and bought bread, ham and cheese and had breakfast. We did not use the restaurant for dinner, since we were there for a wedding in nearby Humacao, so we ate there, and I'm glad it was that way. Also the room doors and the frame are metal, so every time you close the door, it slams. Slams so hard that I could hear it from far away. A little annoying. I'm not a picky person, the only thing I ask for is a room in working order. I do not think I will stay again....

Reviews.Title: “Unsecurity & Broken Rusty Pools Gates Not Safe for Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Broken and rusty pool gates not safe for little kids, roaches in some rooms, sometimes no fresh water at all or no hot water, electricity facilities is terrible and the sponsor Juan Lopez need to be re-trained in " HUMAN RELATIONS " WITH HIS HOTEL GUESSES.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tamiris
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Parador Palmas de Lucia (on the southeast corner of Puerto Rico) and were disappointed. The hotel is near the beach, but not on it. There is a small building between the hotel and the beach, which blocks the view. Maybe there is a better view of the ocean from the second floor rooms, but from our first floor room, we only had a peak. The building has seen better days. The doors to the interior corridor all looked in really bad shape. We thought from the description of the place that it was new, so were disappointed. All in all, if we had to do it over again, we would not choose that hotel nor that location. We did pass another hotel nearby, up on a hill, overlooking the ocean. If for some reason we wanted to stay near there again, I would try to find the name of the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh....so relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 03-07 Feb 05, great getaway for couples w/o children. Hidden away on the lower east coast w/ great calendar like scenery. On site restaurant w/ good variety of local cousine. Very lay back staff, so go w/ relaxation in mind and deal with slow but great service. Rooms have necessary amenities, no frills. Nicely manicured garden, open pool, and near by public beach (no services). Shorth drive to larger serviced beach. Hotel has an all-inclusive & ala carte mode for the restaurant; we took the ala carte and has an expanded menu, did great. We would defitnetly return as long we stay childless. During weekdays we had the hotel to ourselves as the local influx departed on Sunday for the workweek, the stargazing was out of this world. Again, think relaxation, low draw...if unable to cope Palmas del Mar is 15 minutes away @ $300/day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Very good service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Palmas de Lucia four days on January 2005. We requested a deluxe room package with all-inclusive. The room was nicely equipped, microwave,refrigerator, king bed, cofee maker with compliment coffe ,Cable TV etc... The package was for three days and 2 nights and we requested an extra night because the service was excellent. The hotel is only two minutes from the Toll Highway and aproximately 7-10 minutes from Humacao City which has a huge shopping mall with cinema theaters and lots of restaurants. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the beach. It was very dirty, lots of crabs and it was not swimmable. Everything else was lovely fo the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paradores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have fond memories of this area from visiting Yabucoa as a child. I stayed here in April of 2004 with my 6 yr old son at Palmas de Lucia for 8 nights and enjoyed the facilities, warm and welcoming staff, and cleanliness of the rooms. All of the staff was bi-lingual which very helpful. My son enjoyed the game room, basketball court and pool. This truly could be considered a family resort. The beach adjacent to this property should be for walking and sunbathing only as the currents and riptides are dangerous, it is nonetheless very picturesque, soothing and a relaxing place to vist. The only recommendation or drawback when traveling with children here is that the menu for the restaurant is somewhat limited for a childrens menu. If you have a rental car there are supermarkets and other "Americanized restaurants" close by to get you over that challenge! This was a memorable trip for my son and myself!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Beach :o(”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed at this parador for 4 nights and we were totally wrong picking this place. Very very dirty beach - it is not swimable and you cannot lay down or walk on it. Food was OK (we didn't have any other choices), and one of the waiters was so mean, when we came in around 8.30 pm - he said they would be closed at 9 pm and we supposed to come in earlier !!!!! We're so regret that we stayed in this parador.

Reviews.Title: “Low rates - but watch out....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were fine and pretty quiet. Stayed three days - on the last day when I looked for my Nautica jacket I left in the closet -it was not in the room (unfortunately for me my wallet was in this jacket as well). Moral of this story - do not keep anything of value in the hotel rooms at this hotel since the cinchy key locks to the room or room service is not trustworthy. Fortunately I was able to cancel all my cards upon arriving back in the states that evening - only hit with a 10.00 gas bill on one of the cards before more charges had racked up.

Reviews.Title: “Kindly with excellent service at Palmas de Lucia”
Reviews.Author: richi
Reviews.Content: Date:30 Dec. 2003Hi,Enjoy your self,We was with a group of 13 persons who staying in this Hotel.( 27 aug. - 2 sept. 2003). We staying 7 days en the service are excellent. The ouwner of the Hotel is a good person to meet. Also he was so kindly and give us a free breakfast the last day when we must left, because ours sons have won the title of the minor league tournament in Yabucoa. So are many thingsthat I recommended everone who will staying in Hotel Palmas de Lucia, can get from me this beautifull experience that we have received.So I give my words and than is you turn to feel happy in this Hotel and enjoy your holiday.By by ,Richi from Curacao, Neth.Ant.

HotelInfo.Name: Parador Palmas De Lucia
HotelInfo.Address: Panoramic Rd 901 Int 9911 | Sector Playa Lucia, Yabucoa 00767, Puerto Rico
